name: Barren Heat
description: When a massive increase of travel to the surface of Ceti Alpha V leads Starfleet to investigate, the Sarcophagus appears to maintain the secrets on the planet's surface. Take down the Klingon flagship and investigate the mystery of this barren sand heap.
rules:
-- In a Skirmish Event, you will engage in space battles against thematically appropriate foes until the Event's conclusion.
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- Unique Ship Battle Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using any version of Kirk, B. Sisko, W. Crusher or matching a Battle Trait will provide a bonus.
-- Using the Klingon Sarcophagus, U.S.S. Enterprise NCC-1701, or Klingon K'Vort Bird-of-Prey will provide a bonus to hull.
-- Every Ship Battle you win earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Kirk, B. Sisko, or W. Crusher

featured_crew.name: DaiMon Solok
featured_crew.flavor: Hired by Picard, Solok smuggled Picard and his team through Cardassian controlled territory.

action.name: When do you want to leave?

featured_crew.name: Wesley
featured_crew.flavor: Wesley Crusher was a Starfleet cadet for three years before leaving with The Traveler.

rewards.name: Credits
rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

ship.name: Klingon K'Vort Bird-of-Prey
ship.flavor: A versatile craft often used for scouting and patrolling. The K'Vort-class is the most stable iteration of this design.

rewards.flavor: Use to instantly revive a failed Voyage.

rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.name: Skill
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 6 Polestars: Command, Diplomacy, Security, Engineering, Science, Medicine

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: DaiMon Solok
rewards.flavor: Hired by Picard, Solok smuggled Picard and his team through Cardassian controlled territory.

action.name: When do you want to leave?

rewards.name: Wesley
rewards.flavor: Wesley Crusher was a Starfleet cadet for three years before leaving with The Traveler.

rewards.name: Rarity
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

content.reroll_info:
Skirmish rewards are additive. By continuously rolling you receive additional rewards. No rewards are lost by rolling again.
DROP RATES:
Event VP: 13.58%
Time Portal Pack: 0.13%
Chronitons: 11.45%
Honor: 14.11%
Intel: 27.43%
Credits: 33.29%

screens.text: "Captain, thanks for answering my hails. You're probably not going to believe this, but the Sarcophagus has appeared just above Ceti Alpha V. We were sent here after Starfleet noticed an uptick in travel to the planet's surface. I mean, it's an abandoned sand heap."

"What are they hiding down there? And this Sarcophagus is an upgrade from its original form. The weapons, the shields, everything is far more powerful than ever before. Whoever's piloting it has already destroyed several Starfleet vessels."
"If you're taking on the Sarcophagus, then show no mercy! Do not stay your hand for a second, historic vessel or not!"
"Yes, give them hell! If the Klingons want to dig around on Ceti Alpha V, then strand them there!"

"Captain, thanks for answering my hails. You're probably not going to believe this, but the Sarcophagus has appeared just above Ceti Alpha V. We were sent here after Starfleet noticed an uptick in travel to the planet's surface. I mean, it's an abandoned sand heap."

"What are they hiding down there? And this Sarcophagus is an upgrade from its original form. The weapons, the shields, everything is far more powerful than ever before. Whoever's piloting it has already destroyed several Starfleet vessels."
"If you're taking on the Sarcophagus, then show no mercy! Do not stay your hand for a second, historic vessel or not!"
"Yes, give them hell! If the Klingons want to dig around on Ceti Alpha V, then strand them there!"
"Damn, these Klingons don't give up, do they? At least your assault managed to buy the other damaged vessels some time and we've managed to beam the injured aboard other vessels for aid."

responses.text: "If the Empire is uninvolved, then why is a Klingon vessel here?"
"Who else could be piloting the Sarcophagus?"
"What else do we know about what's going on on the surface?"

screens.text: "This is not the Empire's work! They would never allow a relic like the Sarcophagus to end up on a crusty rock like this! On that note, they expect the Sarcophagus returned to them--or whatever remains once you've finished bringing down the petaQ who stole it!"

"The Empire is as good as its word, but for your information, the Sarcophagus was stolen from its place of reverence several weeks ago. If this is the work of other Klingons, it is not at the behest of the Empire itself."
"I'm not sold on this not being a Klingon ploy, but take your pick of the usual suspects. The Romulans, the Borg, the Cardassians..."

"For the brief period of time we were able to get close, it appeared to be some sort of mining operation. For what it's worth, the Sarcophagus is putting off residue from an unfamiliar element, which makes me wonder if that's what they're mining."
"The Sarcophagus is gearing up for another assault. Captain, we could use your help to bring the culprit in once and for all!"
"Damn, these Klingons don't give up, do they? At least your assault managed to buy the other damaged vessels some time and we've managed to beam the injured aboard other vessels for aid."

responses.text: "If the Empire is uninvolved, then why is a Klingon vessel here?"
"Who else could be piloting the Sarcophagus?"
"What else do we know about what's going on on the surface?"

"The Empire is as good as its word, but for your information, the Sarcophagus was stolen from its place of reverence several weeks ago. If this is the work of other Klingons, it is not at the behest of the Empire itself."
"I'm not sold on this not being a Klingon ploy, but take your pick of the usual suspects. The Romulans, the Borg, the Cardassians..."

"For the brief period of time we were able to get close, it appeared to be some sort of mining operation. For what it's worth, the Sarcophagus is putting off residue from an unfamiliar element, which makes me wonder if that's what they're mining."
"The Sarcophagus is gearing up for another assault. Captain, we could use your help to bring the culprit in once and for all!"
